alert.note: Alert for Boone (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:24PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kanawha, northwestern Fayette and northeastern Boone Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chesapeake, or 14 miles southeast of Charleston, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Burnwell, Powellton, Whitesville, Handley, Sylvester, Seth, Leewood, Dawes, Prenter and Sharon. This includes West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 66 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
